titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Georgiĭ Titovich Kii͡ashchenko papers

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, military documents, printed matter, and photographs relating to Russia in World War I and to Russian émigré affairs.

altformavail.head: Location of Originals
altformavail.p: In part, originals in: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual or digital material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Georgiĭ Titovich Kii͡ashchenko papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: General Georgiĭ Titovich Kii͡ashchenko was born in the town of Starodub in 1872. He was educated at the Chuguev Military School, and his military career culminated with the rank of major general and the title of director of military transport in the Far East in 1919. He was a participant in the Russian army's 1915 Lodz operation, about which he left notes for a lecture. In San Francisco in the 1920s and 1930s, Kii͡ashchenko became an active participant in Russian Orthodox Church politics and the émigré monarchist movement.

Most of his views on these subjects were expressed in the pages of Nashe slovo and Viera i pravda, and a number of other pamphlets, periodicals and leaflets, which he edited and published. He supported the Russian Orthodox Church Outside Russia, as well as the Grand Duke Vladimir Kirillovich's claim to the Russian throne. Kii͡ashchenko died in San Francisco on 19 January 1940.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Speeches and writings, correspondence, military documents, printed matter, and photographs relating to Russia in World War I and to Russian émigré affairs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Microfilm Portion of Collection
scopecontent.p: SPEECHES AND WRITINGS contains the periodicals Nashe slovo and Viera i pravda, which Kii͡ashchenko edited and published in San Francisco. There is also a large amount of related material, including appeals by various organizations, in the SUBJECT FILE. Also of interest are the letters and notices in CORRESPONDENCE from the Ob"edinenie Chuguevskago voennago uchilishcha, of which Kii͡ashchenko was a member.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials remain in the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco as its property. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

The Hoover Institution assumes all responsibility for notifying users that they must comply with the copyright law of the United States (Title 17 United States Code) and Hoover Rules for the Use and Reproduction of Archival Materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clipping, commendation, and programs, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

did.unittitle: Programs of public events featuring Kiiashchenko

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and attachments, arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes, articles and fragments of articles, speeches, and letters to the editor, arranged chronologically by title. See also Subject File for leaflets and brochures by other authors issued by Kii͡ashchenko, including articles and editorials by him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notebooks with holograph drafts of articles and letters to the editor, notes, fragments of works, appeals, flyers and leaflets composed by Kiiashchenko, 1938 and undated.

did.unittitle: Periodicals edited, issued, and primarily authored by Kiiashchenko,

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bound volumes lack those issues placed at head of series.

did.unittitle: Listki v chest' Bratstva Sv. Rusi imeni Sv. Kniazia Vladimira, fragment
"Imperator Nikolai II i Gosudarstvennaia Duma," printed copy,
"K poznaniiu istokov Rossiiskoi razrukhi," printed copy,
"Kliuch k edinstvu russkago razsieianiia," printed copy,
"Kto zhe on poslie 10-12 lietnei davnosti?," typescript,
"Lodz'," speech before an audience at the Russian Club, San Francisco, holograph,
"Mirovaia missiia Rossii," speech before an audience at the Russian Club, San Francisco, holograph, typescript, and printed copy,
"O griadushchikh sud'bakh Rossii," holograph and typescript,
"O tsarstvie mira na zemlie," printed copy,
"Pochemu sniaty preshcheniia i vozstanovlena sovmiestnaia molitva," holograph,
"Pora okonchit' spory," Russkaia mysl', printed copy,
"Smysl i sposoby bor'by s Internatsionalom," typescript,
Untitled work on émigré politics, holograph,
Untitled work on Russian Orthodox Church affairs abroad, typescript,
"Besiedy k poznaniiu Rossii: Soznanie russkimi liud'mi ikh gosudarstvennoi idei," holograph,
"O prichinakh 'Rokovoi oshibki'," Viera i pravda, printed copy,
"Besieda o dushevnykh zabolievaniiakh obshchestva," printed copy,
Komu nuzhna byla gibel' Rossii, printed copy,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings, leaflets and brochures by other authors issued by Kii͡ashchenko, arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes appeals, brochures, bulletins, and other materials relating to the émigré monarchist movement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily concerns conflicts within the Russian Orthodox Church abroad in the 1920s and 1930s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appeals, clippings, leaflets, brochures and writings on a variety of subjects, primarily of a religious or political nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One print of Admiral A. V. Kolchak and one of an unidentified individual, possibly Kii͡ashchenko's son.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Original materials added to microfilm collection from the Museum of Russian Culture.
